parameters:
\N<Segi>...Today is Riia's birthday, after all. Let's talk to Riia
before we go out.

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, I apologize for the suddenness. There's something
I absolutely must tell you.
\N<Rozaro>That is... I went too far yesterday.

\N<Rozaro>Despite knowing the difficult position you're in, I'm
ashamed of myself for rubbing salt in your wounds by
questioning your resolve.
\N<Segi>No... You're right, Rozaro-san. I was too naive...

\N<Rozaro>Don't say that... The truth is, I've been thinking since
then. Whether there's a way to win without hurting Miss
Irime, just as you said.
\N<Segi>Could it be... there is such a way? What kind of...?

\N<Rozaro>It's simple, we weaken her to completely immobilize her
movements. Then we can demand her surrender.
\N<Segi>Immobilize her movements... Is that even possible for me?

\N<Rozaro>To be honest, I don't know. But fortunately, there's still
time before the match. Let's not give up and think of the
best method together.

\N<???>Ma'am... I have a message for you from Zozoie. I'm sorry,
but please open up.
\N<Segi>The day of my battle has finally come...

\N<Segi>It's the day that will decide the fate of myself, Riia, and
Lord Yuia.
\N<Segi>I... I must go to the training grounds...
\N<Riia>Hey... Mom. About the day after tomorrow...
\N<Segi>What's wrong, Riia? You seem a bit fidgety.

\N<Segi>Hehe, it's okay. Mom remembers. The day after tomorrow is
your birthday, right? I'll make a feast for you.

\N<Riia>Are you sure... it's okay? I mean... with Dad and
everything, isn't it tough...

\N<Segi>...Yes, that's true. But that's a separate matter. You don't
need to worry about it.

\N<Segi>Your birthday is an important day for you. We have to be
thankful that you were born to your dad and me.
\N<Segi>Oh, why? Besides, I'm sure Dad feels the same way.

\N<Segi>So, we have to celebrate for Dad too. Otherwise, Mom will
get scolded by him.
\N<Segi>See? Riia, you don't have to worry about anything.
\N<Riia>Yeah... I understand. I'm looking forward to it.
\N<Segi>...What business do you have at our home?
\N<Luda Soldier>Don't be so defensive. I am a messenger from Lord Zuuteruka.
\N<Luda Soldier>Take this, it's your next opponent.

\N<Luda Soldier>Hmph, I've delivered it indeed. Use the time until the day
of battle to train both your mind and body.
\N<Riia>What's wrong, Mom? Your face... it's all red...
\N<Segi>I see... so that's why Irime-san back then...

\N<Riia>Lately... I feel like Rame-chan is keeping some secret from
me.

\N<Riia>I-I mean, it's not like I particularly want to help or
anything, but still... you'd be curious too, right? If
someone's keeping secrets from you?

\N<Riia>After all... maybe she won't tell me anything because I'm
weak? If that's the case, maybe if I become stronger, she'll
rely on me more...?

\N<Segi>Of course. I was just talking with that person. There's
nothing to worry about.

\N<Segi>Did I scare you? That person got excited and rough, so Mama
chased him away.

\N<Segi>Did I scare them away? That person got excited and rough, so
Mama drove them off.
\N<Segi>Good morning, today is your birthday, isn't it, Riia?

\N<Segi>Hehe, even if Riia doesn't care, Mama does. And didn't I say
that we have to celebrate properly on occasions like this?

\N<Segi>Then off you go. Everything will be ready by the time you
come back from the training grounds.

\N<Segi>Let's enjoy today to the fullest with Mama, okay? So much
that Papa will be jealous.

\N<Segi>And then... when Papa comes back, let's tell him all about
today and make him happy.

\N<Riia>...Welcome back, Mom. I was worried because you didn't come
home until late.

\N<Riia>But it's okay, because you came back. It must have been
something important, right? You're tired too, aren't you?
Are you going to rest now?
\N<Segi>I'm sorry... Mom, I broke our promise...

\N<Riia>Stop it... It's fine. I'm not worried about it. Besides, I'm
not a child anymore.

\N<Riia>Really, it's true! And nothing happened with Rame-chan
either. Not that I was expecting anything...

\N<Segi>This... is for you. It must be a present from Rame-chan to
you.

\N<Riia>What's this... It's all scratched up... And why does Mom
have Rame-chan's present?
\N<Segi>...She entrusted it to me. She wanted me to give it to you.

\N<Riia>Huh... I see. She could have just given it to me herself.
But well... that's right. My birthday isn't something Rame-
chan would care about.

\N<Segi>That's not true, that's not true at all. Surely, this
pendant that has become all scratched up is filled with her
feelings.

I thought to myself how absurd it was... what I was saying
seemed so ridiculous.

The current me has no place to speak to my son from a high
ground.

I, who couldn't even keep a small, very important promise,
have no right to admonish this child.
\N<Riia>Mom, are you okay...? He's not here anymore...

\N<Riia>...Mom was hurt by him. So... please, rest until you're
healed, okay?
\N<Segi>I see... So it was you, Riia, who carried Mom here.

\N<Segi>Thank you... But I'm alright now. Seeing Riia's face made
Mom feel better.

\N<Segi>More importantly... I'm sorry. Mom broke her promise with
you...

\N<Riia>Stop it... It's fine. I'm not worried about it. I'm not a
child anymore.

\N<Riia>Really, it's true? Besides, nothing happened with Rame-chan.
Not that I was expecting anything...

\N<Segi>This... is for you. It must be a present from Rame-chan to
you.

\N<Riia>What's this... It's all scratched up... And why does Mom
have Rame-chan's present?
\N<Segi>...She entrusted it to me. She wanted me to give it to you.

\N<Riia>Huh... I see. She could have just given it to me herself.
But well... that's right. My birthday probably doesn't
matter to Rame-chan.

\N<Segi>That's not true, that's not true at all. Surely, this
scratched-up pendant is filled with her feelings.

I thought to myself how absurd it was... what am I even
saying?

I'm in no position to be speaking down to my son from a high
place like this.

I, who couldn't even keep a small, yet very important
promise, have no right to lecture this child.

\N<Segi>I'm sorry, Riia. I've worried you, haven't I? But
everything's okay now.
\N<Riia>Hey, Mama, about that lover he mentioned...

\N<Segi>Haha... It's really silly, isn't it? Riia, you shouldn't
joke with women like that and trouble them, okay?

\N<Segi>More importantly... I'm sorry. Mama broke a promise with
you...

\N<Riia>Stop it... It's fine. I'm not bothered by it. I'm not a
child anymore.

\N<Riia>Really, it's true! And nothing happened with Rame-chan
either. Not that I was expecting anything...

\N<Segi>This... is for you. It must be a present from Rame-chan to
you.

\N<Riia>What's this... It's all scratched up... And why does Mama
have Rame-chan's present?
\N<Segi>...She entrusted it to me. She wanted me to give it to you.

\N<Riia>Huh... I see. She could have just given it to me herself.
But well... That's right. My birthday has nothing to do with
Rame-chan.

\N<Segi>That's not true, that's not true at all. Surely, this
pendant that has become all scratched up is filled with her
feelings.
\N<Segi>You understand what I mean, right, Riia...?

I thought to myself how ridiculous it was... what am I even
saying?

Right now, I'm not in a position to be preaching to my son
from on high.

I couldn't even keep a small, yet very important promise; I
have no right to admonish this child.

\N<Riia>...Welcome back, Mom. I was worried because you didn't come
home until late.

\N<Riia>But it's okay, because you came back. It must have been
important business, right? You're tired too, aren't you? Are
you going to rest now?
\N<Segi>I'm sorry... Mom broke her promise to you...

\N<Riia>Stop it... It's okay. I'm not worried about it. Besides, I'm
not a child anymore.

\N<Riia>Really? And nothing happened with Rame-chan either. Not that
I was expecting anything...

\N<Segi>This... is for you. It must be a present from Rame-chan to
you.

\N<Riia>What's this... It's all scratched up... And why does Mom
have Rame-chan's present?
\N<Segi>...She entrusted it to me. She wanted me to give it to you.

\N<Riia>Huh... I see. She could have just given it to me herself.
But well... I guess it makes sense. My birthday isn't
something Rame-chan would care about.

\N<Segi>That's not true, that's not true at all. Surely, this
pendant that has become all scratched up is filled with her
feelings.

I thought to myself how absurd it was... what I was saying
seemed so ridiculous.

The current me has no place to speak down to my son from a
high ground.

I, who couldn't even keep a small, very important promise,
have no right to lecture this child.

\N<Riia>Rame-chan... If you remembered my birthday, you could have
given this to me yourself...
\N<Segi>I wonder if Mama has been able to protect you properly...

\N<Segi>Irime-san gave her life to protect her family. I'm sure she
has no regrets about that.

\N<Segi>And the same goes for me. I have no regrets about anything
that's happened so far...

\N<Segi>That's why... everything that has happened to me up until
now, and everything that will happen from now on. It's all
my own will...

\N<Segi>I would never... be swept away by that detestable mind,
Luda.

\N<Segi>I won't use such a thing as an excuse... to justify my
actions.
\N<Segi>I wonder if Mama has been able to protect you properly...

\N<Segi>Irime-san risked her life to protect her family. I'm sure
she has no regrets about that.

\N<Segi>And the same goes for me. I have no regrets about what has
happened up until now...

\N<Segi>That's why... everything that has happened to me so far, and
everything that will happen from now on. It's all my own
will...

\N<Segi>I have never been... swept away by that detestable Mind.
Luda.

\N<Segi>I won't use such a thing as an excuse... to justify my
actions.

\N<Segi>...It's about time to start preparing for Riia's
celebration. I wonder if there's anything else I've left
undone...?
I'll think it over once more.

\N<Segi>But there's still time until Riia returns from the training
grounds. What should I do until then...?
Go to Hojiko's shop to get celebration ingredients
Go to the training grounds to pick someone up
Wait for the return at the plaza
Wait for the return at the management office
ホジコの店へ祝いの食材を取りに行く

\N<Segi>That's right... I need to go pick up the birthday
ingredients I ordered from Mr. Hojiko's store...
教練所まで迎えに行く

\N<Segi>That's right... It's a special birthday after all. Maybe I
should go pick him up for a change.

\N<Segi>That's right... Today, I'll make it special and go meet him
halfway.

\N<Segi>It shouldn't take too much time, and I suppose waiting in
the plaza would be fine.

\N<Segi>That's right... It's a special birthday after all. Maybe I
should go pick him up for a change.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Though
vague, a shadow of sadness could be seen on her face.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. A clear
shadow of gloom was evident on her face.
\N<Segi>...I don't want to think about anything right now.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her face
was flushed, and her breaths contained a sweet tinge.

\N<Segi>...Haa... Haa... Why is this happening... What's going to
happen to my body...?

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her
expression was no different from usual.
\N<Segi>...There's no particular problem. I can still go on...

To raise funds, Segi can sell her personal belongings. These
items are not sold at regular stores but can be done at the
Luda barracks.

Also, please note that once sold, personal belongings will
not be replenished until the next battle.
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...

\N<Segi>It's frustrating, but... it might be just as Zuuteruka said.
The erosion of my mind by Luda feels like it's progressing
faster than before...

\N<Segi>But... now's not the time to talk about that... I have to
pull myself together...
About the purpose of the Training Soldiers Assembly
About the Training Soldiers Assembly regulations
・経典結社リュダについて

The religious society that conquered and destroyed "Akatsuki
no Ho," the hometown of Segi and Yuia, manages its followers
through unique scriptures and military force.

It can be called a night-watch state, and in recent years,
it has expanded its influence by subjugating surrounding
villages one after another with its high technological and
military power.
・練兵会開催の目的について

Each family is forced to provide one representative for
military service, and these representatives are made to
fight each other in combat tournaments for training
purposes.

Multiple of these duels between residents are held
simultaneously, and afterwards, a few outstanding soldiers
are selected to be recruited into the ranks of Luda.

After the opponents are decided, the battle takes place
after a few days' grace period. During this time, the
participating warriors will devise strategies for the fight.

The duel is decided by death, incapacitation, or surrender.
However, even surrender does not guarantee safety
thereafter, let alone death or incapacitation.

If a man loses the battle, he is imprisoned and subjected to
harsh forced labor. Women are forced to live as the
concubines of the victors or Luda soldiers.

The goal is to win the training tournament and save her
imprisoned husband Yuia through the amnesty that comes as a
reward.

To do this, she must gather information on her opponents in
the tournament, train herself in the ruins, and win the
competition.

Meanwhile, Yuia, who has been imprisoned as a serious
criminal, needs tributes to Luda for his life extension
measures, and Segi must not let this tribute lapse during
the tournament.

If the tribute lapses, it means losing the guarantee of life
for her imprisoned husband Yuia.

The side effects caused by Segi, who lacks combat
experience, taking the secret drug "Mind.Luda" to enhance
her physical abilities.

Her lust rises and accumulates daily, and when it reaches
its limit (maximum value 100), an uncontrollable intense
sexual urge will overcome her body.

To prevent lust, it is necessary to lower the maximum value
through meetings with her husband Yuia or medication.
Engaging in sexual acts is also effective in relieving
sexual urges.

The ruins that gave their name to the underwater ruins city
where Segi and others live. It was once a tunnel dug using
criminals.

Rare resources were excavated inside the ruins, but at the
same time, it became a dangerous place filled with poisonous
gases and rampant monsters.

The poisonous gases continue to seep out even now. However,
since Luda's technology has developed an antidote to avoid
the gases, exploration inside has become possible.

The story is divided into chapters for each match, such as
the first match → second match.

Gather information for your next battle in town, explore the
ruins to acquire money and items.

In scenes where useful information or story-progressing
events occur, a [■EV occurrence■] mark will be displayed.

\C[1]Blue \C[0] indicates conversation events or story
progression flags, \C[10]red\C[0] is displayed when an event
scene is included.

The story may progress by advancing the date. If you feel
that nothing is progressing, rest in your home bed.

If there's a \C[3]■Rest Possible■\C[0] mark on your home
bed, you can recover your stamina and move time forward to
the next day.

In this case, minor conversation events that could occur on
that day will be skipped as time moves to the next day.

Each character generally appears in the same place. It is
recommended to visit places like Rozaro's tavern or Irime's
home regularly, especially those who are allies.

Segi's ultimate goal is to win the training tournament
without defeat. If achieved, she can save her husband Yuia
and their family can return to their former life.

However, if Segi is defeated by men who aim to fight her in
the tournament, she will become theirs.

By being defiled by them, Segi will face an ending with each
of those men.

On the eve of the final match of the training tournament,
she must choose an ending with one of the men, whether she
wishes to or not...
